Created an attachment (id=63813)
rmap as I'd like it to be

I debugged and the problem is in WorkspaceMaterialize:185

			WorkspaceInfo.setComponentIdentifier(projectForBinding.findMember(projRelativePath),
				mat.getComponentIdentifier());

projectForBinding = .buckminster
projRelativePath = org.eclipse.buckminster.maven.sample.quickstart

My workspace folder has
.buckminster 
.buckminster/maven2
.buckminster/.project
.metadata
org.eclipse.buckminster.maven.sample.quickstart


The component query has <cq:rootRequest name="org.eclipse.buckminster.maven.sample.quickstart"/>
First I thought it was a problem in the rmap that's why I tried another more verbose way to see it it worked
AFAIKS both rmaps seems to be correct. I'll try and reproduce this.

The exception was caused by confusion about if the component was a project or not. The shorterm fix for this was to assume that all components that are folders also are projects and hence should be bound to the workspace if the workspace binder is in effect. Longer term, this will be fixed using the coming Materialization Spec.

In order to test this, I checked in the sample project (see bug 177840 for details). I also copied the rmap used by this example to http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/samples/queries/quickstart.rmap.
